item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

Strucker:

then use that method.

I just tried that and displayed the same thing as before

EDIT: just fixed it by changing the number in the parentheses. Apparently there were two sendInterface methods, one for manual input and one for commanded input

item.title: [RuneSource] Method "sendFullScreenInterface" Doesnt Work?!
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

Strucker:

Are you sending an interface that your client has?

I just found a 377 client that has fullscreen interfaces in it. I even logged in game and typed “::interface 15244” and got a full screen welcome screen to appear. But when I try to do it through the server it does what it used to do, and what i mean by that is that it just appears in the game screen and isnt full screen

Read full topic

item.title: [RuneSource] Method "sendFullScreenInterface" Doesnt Work?!
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

Welcome Moparians to my post, in this episode of “WTF is Wrong With My Source”, I need someone to tell me why the method “sendFullScreenInterface” in a RuneSource source is not functioning properly as it doesn’t even let me log into the game if I try to access it. The REASON why I am trying to access it is to make a welcome screen upon login. However, I can’t log in…

AAAHHAA!!! FIXED IT!!! PM ME IF YOU WANT TO KNOW HOW

Here is the code for the method,

public void sendFullScreenInterface(int interfaceId, int secondVar) { StreamBuffer.OutBuffer out = StreamBuffer.newOutBuffer(7); out.writeHeader(player.getEncryptor(), 69); out.writeShort(interfaceId); out.writeShort(secondVar); player.send(out.getBuffer()); }

Read full topic
